title: How to be confident

title: The distracted mind

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: Talking on the phone and driving.

options.label: B
options.text: We are four times more likely to crash.

options.label: C
options.text: We are able to multitask safely.

options.label: D
options.text: We become completely blind to our environment.

options.label: D

options.label: D

options.label: C
options.text: We are more likely to run out of gas.

options.label: D
options.text: We are more likely to get a speeding ticket.

options.label: A
options.text: Because it is not wired that way.

multiple-choice.question: What can hijack our focus while driving?

options.label: B
options.text: Only things that are related to driving.

options.label: A
options.text: Because it requires a lot of physical effort.

options.label: B
options.text: Because it requires a lot of mental effort.

options.label: C
options.text: Because it requires a lot of both physical and mental effort.

options.label: D
options.text: Because it is not a complex task at all.

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the consequences of not paying attention while driving?

options.label: B
options.text: We might get a speeding ticket.

options.label: D
options.text: We might run out of gas.

options.label: D
options.text: Because they had a lot of help from their neighbors.

multiple-choice.question: What inspired the holiday of Thanksgiving?

options.label: D
options.text: A free gift with every purchase.

multiple-choice.question: What is Hank Green thankful for on Black Friday?

options.text: Giving away the patent to his polio vaccine.

options.label: B

title: How Does It Grow? Cranberries

multiple-choice.question: What is unique about cranberries when it comes to their growing conditions?

options.label: A
options.text: They require a lot of sunlight to grow.

options.label: D
options.text: They require a lot of shade to grow.

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary source of water for cranberry farmers like the Lee brothers?
How do cranberry farmers flood the bogs?

options.label: B
options.text: By using a pump to bring in water.

options.label: C
options.text: By using a natural river that runs along the farm.

multiple-choice.question: What is the purpose of flooding the bogs in December?

options.label: C
options.text: To insulate the vines from harsh winter frost.

multiple-choice.question: How do cranberries grow on the vine?

options.label: D
options.text: They grow on low trailing vines and sunken beds called bogs.

multiple-choice.question: What is unique about the way cranberries ripen?

options.label: B
options.text: They turn blue as they ripen.

options.label: C
options.text: They turn white as they ripen.

options.label: D
options.text: They don't really sweeten as they ripen.

multiple-choice.question: What is the purpose of flooding the bogs in October?
How are cranberries harvested?

options.label: C
options.text: By using a harvester that drives through the bog to knock the berries off the vines.

options.label: D
options.text: By using a combination of machines and manual labor.

multiple-choice.question: What is the purpose of the four air chambers inside a cranberry?

options.label: C
options.text: To allow the cranberry to float.

options.label: D
options.text: To make the cranberry more tart.

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary use of cranberries grown in New Jersey?

options.label: A
options.text: They are sold fresh in supermarkets.

options.label: B
options.text: They are used to make cranberry sauce.

options.label: C
options.text: They are used to make craisins and cranberry juice.

options.label: D
options.text: They are used to make a variety of products, including craisins, cranberry juice, and cranberry sauce.

title: Why do we eat spoiled food?

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary reason why some foods, such as coffee and bread, have the tastes, smells, and textures we love?

options.label: A
options.text: Because of the presence of tiny insects.

options.label: B
options.text: Because of the presence of tiny bacteria and fungi.

options.label: C
options.text: Because of the presence of tiny viruses.

options.label: D
options.text: Because of the presence of tiny worms.

multiple-choice.question: What percentage of microbes are harmless to humans?
What type of conditions do pathogens require to flourish?
What is the purpose of adding salt to food that is left out on the counter?

options.label: A
options.text: To make the food more nutritious.

options.label: B
options.text: To make the food more appetizing.

options.label: C
options.text: To help harmless, salt-tolerant microbes like Lactobacillus outcompete their dangerous but salt-sensitive relatives.

options.label: D
options.text: To make the food more spicy.

multiple-choice.question: What is the result of yeast feeding on the sugary starch in bread dough?
What is the role of mold spores in the production of blue cheese?

options.label: A
options.text: They help to break down the fat molecules in the cheese.

options.label: B
options.text: They help to break down the protein molecules in the cheese.

options.label: C
options.text: They populate small holes and cracks in the cheese, and their relatives munch through the rest of the blob, digesting big protein and fat molecules.

options.label: D
options.text: They help to give the cheese a stronger flavor.

multiple-choice.question: What is the result of bacteria and fungi taking turns munching on piles of cacao?

options.label: C
options.text: The cacao becomes more complex and delicious.

multiple-choice.question: Why do people around the world have different ideas about how to microbe-ify foods?
What is the result of not letting food spoil just a little bit?

options.label: A
options.text: We would have more food available.

options.label: B
options.text: We would have no sauerkraut, soy sauce, pickles, or prosciutto.

options.label: C
options.text: We would have no kefir, kimchi, kombucha, koumiss, or katsuobushi.

options.label: D
options.text: We would have no bread or beer.

multiple-choice.question: What is the relationship between spoiled food and the development of human culture?

options.label: A
options.text: Spoiled food led to the development of human culture.

options.label: B
options.text: Human culture led to the development of spoiled food.

options.label: C
options.text: Spoiled food and human culture developed simultaneously.

options.label: D
options.text: There is no relationship between spoiled food and human culture.

title: Systemic racism explained

multiple-choice.question: What is the main reason why Jamal and Kevin grew up in different worlds with different opportunities for success?

options.label: A
options.text: Because of their family's financial situation.

options.label: B
options.text: Because of America's history of systemic racism.

options.label: C
options.text: Because of their personal choices and decisions.

options.label: D
options.text: Because of their school district's funding.

multiple-choice.question: What was the practice called that involved drawing maps dividing cities into sections that were either desirable or undesirable for investment?
Why were banks more willing to lend to low-income white families than to middle or upper-income African-American families in the 1980s?

options.label: C
options.text: Because of the banks' implicit bias.

multiple-choice.question: What is implicit bias?

options.label: A
options.text: Prejudices in society that people are aware of.

options.label: B
options.text: Prejudices in society that people are not aware of.

options.label: C
options.text: Biases that are based on facts and evidence.

options.label: D
options.text: Biases that are based on personal opinions.

multiple-choice.question: Why did Jamal's resume get less interest than Kevin's, even though they graduated from the same program with the same GPA?
What is an example of systemic racism in education?

options.label: A
options.text: The lack of access to high-quality tutors and extracurricular activities.

multiple-choice.question: What can you do to work towards becoming more aware of your own implicit biases?

options.label: A
options.text: Take a course on racism and bias.

options.label: C
options.text: Reflect on your own thoughts and feelings.

multiple-choice.question: What is an example of a systemic solution to address systemic racism?

options.label: A
options.text: Increasing public school funding and making it independent from property taxes.

options.label: C
options.text: Providing more resources and support for marginalized communities.

multiple-choice.question: Why is it difficult to solve systemic racism?

options.label: A
options.text: Because there is no single person or entity responsible for it.

options.label: B
options.text: Because it is a complex and multifaceted issue.

options.label: C
options.text: Because it is a result of personal choices and decisions.

options.label: D
options.text: Because it is a result of historical events.

multiple-choice.question: What is the role that we all play in making the system better?

options.label: A
options.text: We are all part of the system, which means we all have a role to play in making it better.

options.label: B
options.text: We are all separate individuals, and our actions do not affect the system.

options.label: C
options.text: We are all just observers, and we do not have the power to make changes.

options.label: D
options.text: We are all just victims, and we do not have the power to make changes.

multiple-choice.question: B: Because of America's history of systemic racism.
A: Redlining.
C: Because of the banks' implicit bias.
B: Prejudices in society that people are not aware of.
D: Because of implicit bias.
D: All of the above.
C: Reflect on your own thoughts and feelings.
A: Increasing public school funding and making it independent from property taxes.
A: Because there is no single person or entity responsible for it.
A: We are all part of the system, which means we all have a role to play in making it better.

title: The taxonomy of candy

options.text: To classify and organize living things based on their evolutionary relationships

options.text: As a family of jelly bean candies

options.text: Living organisms can be classified by their evolutionary relationships, while candy cannot

options.text: Candy can be classified by shape, while living organisms cannot

options.label: C
options.text: Creating a list of all living organisms

options.label: D

options.label: A
options.text: That candy can be classified by color

options.label: B
options.text: That candy can be classified by shape

options.label: C
options.text: That candy can be classified in a way that makes sense, but is not the same as classifying living organisms

options.label: A

options.label: D

multiple-choice.question: What is the main point that Emily makes about the classification of Jelly Belly candies?

options.label: A
options.text: That Jelly Belly candies can be classified by color

options.label: B
options.text: That Jelly Belly candies can be classified by shape

options.label: C
options.text: That Jelly Belly candies can be classified in a way that makes sense, but is not the same as classifying living organisms

options.label: D
options.text: That Jelly Belly candies cannot be classified

multiple-choice.question: According to Olivier, what is the relationship between classification and the world?

options.label: A
options.text: That classification is a way of bringing order to the world

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

title: What is Día de los Muertos, the Day of the Dead?

options.text: A time of celebration and a celebration of life.

options.label: C

multiple-choice.question: What is the significance of the smell of flowers during the Day of the Dead celebration?

multiple-choice.question: What is the Day of the Dead a demonstration of?

options.label: A
options.text: A celebration of life and death.

multiple-choice.question: What is the Day of the Dead a reflection of?

options.label: A
options.text: The history of Mexico and its people.

options.label: B
options.text: The culture of Mexico and its people.

options.label: C
options.text: The traditions of Mexico and its people.

options.label: D
options.text: The customs of Mexico and its people.

options.text: The importance of remembering the dead.

options.label: C
options.text: The importance of honoring the living.

options.label: D

title: The most horrifying parasites on the planet

multiple-choice.question: What is the reputation of parasites in general?

options.label: C
options.text: They are nasty and worth avoiding.

options.label: D
options.text: They are essential for the ecosystem.

multiple-choice.question: What is the effect of the Filarial Worm on the human body?

options.label: A
options.text: It causes a build-up of fluid in the lymphatic system.

options.label: B
options.text: It causes a decrease in the immune system.

options.label: C
options.text: It causes a blockage in the blood vessels.

options.label: D
options.text: It causes a increase in the production of red blood cells.

multiple-choice.question: What is the result of the adult female Pinworm exiting the anus?

options.label: A
options.text: It causes a rash on the skin.

options.label: C
options.text: It causes a decrease in the production of eggs.

options.label: D
options.text: It causes an increase in the production of sperm.

options.text: An allergic reaction to their saliva.

options.label: B
options.text: An allergic reaction to their eggs.

options.label: C
options.text: An allergic reaction to their habitat.

options.label: D
options.text: An allergic reaction to their food.

options.label: A
options.text: It causes a build-up of fluid in the lymphatic system.

options.label: B
options.text: It causes abdominal pain and nausea.

options.label: C
options.text: It causes a decrease in the production of red blood cells.

options.label: D
options.text: It causes an increase in the production of white blood cells.

multiple-choice.question: What is the result of the Tongue Biter clinging onto a fish's tongue?

options.label: A
options.text: It causes the fish to lose its appetite.

options.label: B
options.text: It causes the fish to lose its balance.

options.label: C
options.text: It causes the fish to feed on the parasite.

options.label: D
options.text: It causes the fish to mate with the parasite.

options.text: It causes them to become docile.

options.label: C
options.text: It causes them to become zombie-like.

options.label: D
options.text: It causes them to become extinct.
